titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4720

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
Attorney at Law & General Collecting Agent,
FRANKFORT, KY.
&#9758 Special attention given to the collection of all claims confided to him throughout the State of Kentucky.
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KEENON, Ass't Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Keenon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr., Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk.
John L. Sneed, Clerk.
Frankfort, Ky., March 29th, 1864.
Hon. Tho. E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky.
Dr Sir

R. T. McDaniel Sheriff of Christian County for 1862, has paid balance on Revenue, for said year, with interest & costs; and now prays your Excellency to be relieved from the payment of of Seventeeen Hundred and Thirty Two 73/100 Dollars, this being the amount of Damages adjudged against him for the non payment of the Revenue for said year and county at the time required by law

Frankflin Cir Ct
vs
R. T. McDaniel
Sheriff
Christian Co
Revenue
1862
25th Mch/64
